data.scheme_name: National SC-ST Hub - Special Credit Linked Capital Subsidy Scheme (SCLCSS) - New
data.benefits: Scheme provides 25% capital subsidy on loan up to Rs. 100 lakh with maximum subsidy cap of Rs. 25 Lakhs for procurement of Plant & Machinery.
data.eligibility: All units engaged in the manufacturing and service activities are eligible under the scheme.
data.conditions: The beneficiary unit will have to remain in commercial production/service for three years after installation; commissioning of the plant & machinery and equipment.
data.beneficiaries: All units engaged in the manufacturing and service activities are eligible under the scheme.
data.prerequisites:
The beneficiary unit will have to remain in commercial production/service for three years after installation; commissioning of the plant & machinery and equipment.
In case of proprietary MSE, the proprietor shall be SC/ST.
In case of partnership MSE, the SC/ST partners shall be holding at least 51% shares in the unit.
In case of private limited companies, at least 51% shares shall be held by SC/ST promoters.
data.context: This scheme is introduced to encourage SC/ST owned units.
data.objective: This sub-scheme aims for the enhancement of competitiveness and marketability of the products of SCs/STs enterprises.
data.description: Capital subsidy @ 25% of the Term Loan sanctioned for purchase of plant and machinery and equipment (maximum subsidy of Rs. 25 lakhs) shall be available under the Scheme. This would be applicable for proposals/projects, where Term Loans have been sanctioned by the Primary Lending Institutions (PLIs) after notification of this scheme.
data.how_to_apply: The applicant can apply through the link : https://scsthub.in/nssh-schemes/
data.funding_facilitator: SIDBI, NABARD, National Small Industries Corporation Limited (NSIC), Other Primary Lending Institutions (PLI)
data.funding_mechanism: Banks will follow the principle of First -In -First -Out (FIFO) while submitting the claims online under SCLCSS Scheme.
data.additional_info:
SC/ST Units graduated from small scale to medium scale are eligible for subsidy under SCLCSS for three years from the date of graduation.
Industry graduating from small scale to medium scale on account of sanction of additional loan under this scheme shall be eligible for assistance.
Fabricated and second-hand plant and machinery shall not be eligible for consideration for subsidy under this component
data.checklist_info_a:
1. Self-certified copy of URC and GSTIN 
2. Self-certified copy of PAN card                                                                                                                                                          
3. Copy of Caste Certificate of proprietor/all partners/directors                                
4. Details of shareholding in case of partnership/ Private Limited/LLP firm 
5. Bank attested debit statement with PBG charges mentioning Bank Guarantee number and applicant MSEs name 
6. Bank attested and stamped copy of PBG issued by the Bank 
7. Cancelled cheque of the current account of the enterprise from which Bank charges have been debited 
8. Proof of transferred amount as reimbursement by National SC-ST Hub Office/National Small Industries Corporation.                                                                                                         
9. Supply Order/ Purchase Order/ Work Order from CPSE/ Central Government Organisation/ Department/ State PSE.                                                                                            
10. Udyam Registration Certificate (URC) 
11. Other KYC Documents
